Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

ALLEGATION:
Facility is currently not meeting appropriate staffing ratios during third shift.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 3, 2022. Staff 1
reported he works third shift for the Zondervan home. He reported the home
currently has nine boys on unit. Staff 1 reported the ratio for sleeping hours is one
staff member to six youth. Staff 1 reported Zondervan home has not always been
following that ratio and has been having one staff member to nine youth. Staff 1
reported he is concerned about being the only staff member during those nights out
of ratio. Staff 1 reported for the past three months there has only been one staff
member working the weekend nights making the unit out of ratio on third shift. He
also reported that sporadically throughout the week the unit has been out of ratio on
third shift. Staff 1 reported sometimes staff are scheduled to work the third shift but
will call off the day of saying they cannot come into work. Staff 1 reported he is
concerned of something happening with the youth and he will be out of ratio. Staff 1
reported he has talked with his supervisor and the human resource department
2

about the concerns of being out of ratio. He reported he knows that hiring and
maintaining staff during the pandemic has been difficult. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
filled in last night to make sure that they were in ratio. Staff 1 reported the facility
tries to fill the open spots, but it does not always happen. Staff 1 said Staff 2 told him
she would be available if he needed her on third shift when he is the only staff
working. Staff 1 said he appreciates the hard work Staff 2 puts in but if an incident
was to occur it would still take her time to drive to facility which makes the situation
risky.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 3, 2022. Staff 2
reported she is the house supervisor for the unit. Staff 2 reported the facility has
been having a hard time staffing the third shift. Staff 2 said she has been having a
staffing shortage and has been talking with the human resource department about
these concerns, especially as it comes to staffing third shift. Staff 2 reported they
currently have nine youth on the unit and for sleeping hours the ratio is one staff to
six youth. Staff 2 reported some nights they have been running with one staff
member for nine youth, which she is aware is out of ratio. Staff 2 was working the
third shift with Staff 1 so that they were in ratio last night and into this morning.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via phone on March 3, 2022. Chief
Administrator reported that he was made aware of the recent struggle with staffing
third shift at the Zondervan home. Chief Administrator reported he has talked with
Staff 2 and the Human Resource Department about this. The Chief Administrator
reported the facility has been having difficulty with hiring staff in general. He also
reported that there have been some issues with staff being scheduled to work the
third shift and would call off the day of the shift. Due to the short notice, it has
caused even more difficulty to find coverage. The facility is also seeing staff turnover
especially in the night shift area. Chief Administrator reported he is working with
Staff 2 about what shifts need to be filled and working with the administration team
to get the coverage taken care. The Chief Administrator plans on getting the
documentation over the past month of night shift staff to youth ratio.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on March 03, 2022. This consultant completed a
visit of the facility around 6:15 am on March 03, 2022. This consultant was able to
meet with the third shift staff member. During the visit, nine youth were sleeping
within their rooms and there was two staff members present. One of the staff
members was the home supervisor filling in for a staff member that was unable to
work the shift. The facility was in ratio for sleeping hours.
Documents Reviewed:
 Zondervan Program Statement- The program statement for the facility reports the
nighttime staffing ratio is one staff member to every six youth.
 Contract between Michigan Department of Health and Human Services and
Kentwood License- The contract states the contractor must maintain a minimum
of one on-duty direct care worker for every six youth during sleeping hours.
3

 Staff schedule for Week of February 20, 2022- March 5, 2022: The schedule
notes five different days where there is only one third shift member scheduled.
The schedule has highlighted marks requesting for staff to fill the open spots.
 Zondervan Daily Census for January 24, 2022-February 27, 2022: The daily
census notes that each night there was at least seven youth sleeping on
Zondervan Unit meaning to be in ratio two staff members should be working.
 Zondervan Timesheet for third shift employees for January 21, 2022-March 4,
2022- The times sheet shows there was eight shifts out of thirty-three shifts
where the facility only had one third shift staff member working during sleeping
hours.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-
to-resident ratio formula for direct care workers.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as they have not been
meeting the ratio requirements during sleeping hours. Evidence
through staff interviews and staffing schedules, there was
evidence showing during sleeping hours there were times where
only one staff was working when there were nine youth on the
unit. The ratio requirement per the contract and program
statement is one staff to six students during sleeping hours.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be made to the
license status of this child caring institution
